newsitem.title: USA: A.D.A.M., Columbia/HCA in healthcare deal.
newsitem.headline: A.D.A.M., Columbia/HCA in healthcare deal.

text.p: Columbia/HCA Healthcare Corp and A.D.A.M Software Inc said on Thursday they would work together to provide healthcare information to consumers through multimedia products.
The two would work together to offer videos, CD-ROM programs and other forms of electronic communication which focus on medical, health and wellness information, they said in a statement.
Columbia would offer existing A.D.A.M. CD-ROM products through its consumer health magazines as well as over its internet site and in hospital gift shops, the companies said.
A.D.A.M. was not immediately available to comment on the financial value of the deal. Its shares were up 5/8 to 3.

"We believe consumers will find these programs very helpful for educating themselves about their health. We are pleased to join with A.D.A.M. Software in order to develop quality health education products for our patients," said Richard Scott, Columbia chairman and chief executive officer.
The relationship was expected to grow to include more A.D.A.M. Software products and the development of specific products for Columbia, the companies said.
